US.title: Be concise and impact-focused
US.body: Hiring teams expect concise stories that highlight outcomes, metrics, and ownership. Keep answers structured with a clear result.

US.title: Prepare thoughtful questions
US.body: Interviewers often reserve time for candidate questions. Bring 3â€“5 questions about team priorities, success metrics, and collaboration.

UK.title: Use structured examples
UK.body: STAR-style responses work well. Emphasize collaboration and stakeholder alignment while keeping the tone professional.

UK.title: Link to company values
UK.body: Many UK employers weigh cultural fit. Reference company values or mission in your examples.

CA.title: Highlight collaboration
CA.body: Canadian interview norms lean toward teamwork and cross-functional alignment. Mention how you partner across teams.

CA.title: Expect multi-step processes
CA.body: Be ready for multiple interview rounds. Ask about timelines and next steps to stay aligned.
